source_sentence: 譬如有人為王除怨(至)過去本業受苦樂也。
translation: It's like a person who removes an enemy for the king (to) experience pain and pleasure from past actions.
Commentary.
Sengliang said.
"It's possible to realize there's a present reward.
It doesn't have to exhaust the causes of past actions.

source_sentence: 仁者若以斷業因緣力故(至)心喻於林身喻於樹。
translation: If you, sir, use the power of the causes and conditions for ending karma (to) compare your mind to a forest and your body to a tree, then you'll realize that there's a present reward.
Commentary.
Sengliang said.
'Compensation can't be completed.'
If he refuses, he won't accept it.
If suffering is the reward, then an animal will attain the path.
An animal should attain the path.
"First, you should temper your mind.
The body is likened to a tree.
There are many trees, but few trees.
The four aggregates are likened to a forest.
The aggregate of form is likened to a tree.
Fear arises from the mind.
It doesn't come from form.

source_sentence: 須跋陀言世尊我已先調伏(至)受於惡身況其餘者。
translation: Subhadra said, "Bhagavān, I've first disciplined (him) to accept a bad body, so why wouldn't I accept the rest?
Commentary.
Baoliang said.
"After the Buddha rebukes him, he'll be able to remove harsh thoughts.
"He can remove debilitating thoughts.
Why doesn't it remove subtle thoughts?

source_sentence: 世尊云何能斷一切諸有(至)上智觀故得無上菩提。
translation: Bhagavān, how can you end all existences and attain unsurpassed enlightenment because you observe superior cognition?
Commentary.
Sengliang said.
'There's nominal emptiness and real emptiness.
But non-Buddhists fetter the bonds.
It's conditioned by existence and not conditioned by emptiness.
Conditioned by emptiness is the conception of the real.'
Baoliang said.
"There are only two truths.
Forgetting characteristics is a real perception.
It's really wisdom that ends affliction.
He creates concepts and names and explains them.
This is also their intention.

source_sentence: 說是法時十千菩薩(至)須跋陀羅得阿羅漢果。
translation: When this teaching was given, 10,000 bodhisattvas (to) Subhadra attained the fruit of the arhat.
Commentary.
Baoliang said.
"Someone who has attained the perception of reality in a lifetime ...
He'll attain Buddhahood after just one lifetime.
If it's the result of nescience abiding in the ground.

source_sentence: 則不可以一生二生往格也。
translation: Then it wouldn't be possible to go to the level of two lifetimes.
He's only discerning it in terms of response.
If we look into the proportions of the other sutras, then it's not yet complete.
Then it's not yet complete.

source_sentence: 大般涅槃經集解卷第七十一(終)
translation: Collection and Explanation of the Sutra of the Great Decease (Final), Volume 71

source_sentence: 觀應二年(辛卯)卯月十日。
translation: On the tenth day of the morning moon in the second year (Xinmao) of Kangyō.
At the Great Imperial Wheel Temple in the state of Mahāvairocana.
He had it written down.

source_sentence: 自觀應元年九月二十四日。
translation: It began on the 24th day of the ninth month in the first year of Kangyō.
It ran from the 24th day of the ninth month in the first year of Avalokitêśvara to the 10th day of the fourth month in the second year of Avalokitêśvara.
It's seventy-one volumes in one.
It's a yearly edition of the Dhāraṇī that's preached and praised.
It's all dotted with one stroke of the brush.

source_sentence: 偏為奉助興正菩薩御願而已。
translation: It's simply a contribution to the royal vow of the Prosperous Correct Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 大御輪寺金剛資　圓宗(生年六十五度以四十五)
translation: Vajraśekhara of the Great Imperial Wheel Temple, Yuanzong (born 65 years ago, 65 degrees and 45 years ago)
